main event: On 27th November 1957, near Miamisburg, Ohio, a very dark object was observed traveling from the NE to the SSW for about 3 minutes. The object appeared to be tumbling end over end as it traveled.
interesting points: The object was observed to be tumbling end over end as it traveled, indicating an irregular motion.
The report states that the data given was too indefinite for further evaluation and did not permit conclusions as to the probable identity of the object.

A bright object moving in a northeast direction over the Miami Valley area was observed by several astronomers. It was visible for about 30 seconds, appearing like a bright, brilliant star-like object.

The object was reported to be traveling at a high rate of speed, about the same brightness as the first magnitude stars, and was observed passing in a northwest to southeast direction at about 8:25 p.m. EST.
Similar sightings of the object had been reported in Europe, and the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory at Cambridge, Mass., had been informed of the sightings.
sighted object: very dark object traveling irregularly from NE to SSW
